alert.note: Alert for Southeast Polk County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 5:42PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Polk County through 615 PM CDT... At 542 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hartley, or 10 miles northwest of Umpire, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cossatot River State Park... Bard Springs Recreation Area... Shady... Caney Creek Wilderness... Hartley... Shady Lake Recreation Area... Roaring Branch Natural Area... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
